isis.stitle: FULL POWER HYDRAULIC ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - REMOVE AND INSTALL - MANIFOLD/CARTRIDGE ASSEMBLY (PART OF sahr canister)

calloutgroup.callout1: 8. CUT-OFF VALVE CORE, PART OF MANIFOLD/CARTRIDGE ASSEMBLY

svcprocinfo.para: The manifold/cartridge assembly comprises the active hydraulic components located inside of the SAHR canister. A malfunction requiring replacement of this component may cause brake fluid to leak into the SAHR canister, therefore removal of the canister is recommended prior to removing this component. The manifold/cartridge can then be replaced on the bench. Refer to FIGURE 71 for component location information while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Remove the SAHR canister from the frame rail. Refer to the SAHR CANISTER Removal procedures . Do NOT remove components from the SAHR assembly until instructed to do so in these procedures.
Using a suitable container drain the brake fluid from the brake line fitting on the canister.
Move the SAHR canister to a work bench.
Remove the coil assembly from the cut-off valve. Do not remove the cut-off valve core. Retain the coil and retaining nut for use during installation.

note.para: If the manifold/cartridge is being replaced due to a seal failure, brake fluid may be present inside of the canister body. This fluid can only be drained once the manifold has been removed. While performing the next 2 steps assume that fluid is present in the canister body, and be prepared to prevent leakage.

step1.para: Carefully clamp the body of the SAHR canister in a vise to prevent it from turning. If possible, position the canister with the boot down and the manifold up. This will prevent any brake fluid in the canister from leaking out when the manifold is removed.
Using a wrench on the flats of the manifold, unscrew the manifold/cartridge assembly from the SAHR canister by turning it in a ccw direction.
Remove the manifold/piston and cylinder assembly from the canister by pulling it straight out of the canister housing. Verify that the cylinder was removed from the canister housing.
Verify that the urethane O-ring seal for the manifold assembly has been removed from the canister housing.
Unclamp the canister and drain all fluid from the canister into a suitable container.
Carefully clamp the body of the SAHR canister in a vise to prevent it from turning.
Ensure that the new urethane O-ring seal is seated at the base of the threads on the manifold/piston and cylinder assembly.

caution.para: When handling the new manifold assembly do not damage the cut-off valve core. Any damage to the cut-off valve core could prevent the parking brake from operating correctly.

step1.para: Thread the manifold/piston and cylinder assembly into the canister (turn cw) by hand until snug.
Using a wrench on the flats of the manifold, torque the manifold/piston assembly to 50 lbf-ft. The cut-off valve must be on the opposite side of the canister from the mounting studs.

caution.para: In the following step do not tighten the coil retaining nut to more than 6.7 Nm (60 Lbf-in). Overtightening the nut will damage the cut-off valve core.

step1.para: Place the coil onto the cut-off valve core so that the connector is correctly positioned, and secure with the retaining nut. Tighten the nut to 5 to 6.7 Nm (44 to 60 Lbf-in).
Install the SAHR canister on the frame rail. Refer to SAHR CANISTER Installation procedures .
